vague_description: A bakery needs to determine how many almond and pistachio croissants to produce in order to minimize production time while meeting ingredient constraints and popularity demands.
detailed_description: A bakery makes almond and pistachio croissants. An almond croissant requires \param{ButterA} units of butter and \param{FlourA} units of flour. A pistachio croissant requires \param{ButterP} units of butter and \param{FlourP} units of flour. The bakery has available \param{TotalButter} units of butter and \param{TotalFlour} units of flour. Since the almond croissant is more popular, at least \param{AlmondPistachioRatio} times as many almond croissants should be made as pistachio croissants. If making an almond croissant takes \param{TimeA} minutes and making a pistachio croissant takes \param{TimeP} minutes, how many of each should be made to minimize the total production time?
target_objective: Minimize the total production time for almond and pistachio croissants
target_constraints: Number of almond croissants is an integer
Number of pistachio croissants is an integer
Number of almond croissants is non-negative
Number of pistachio croissants is non-negative
Butter used for almond croissants and pistachio croissants cannot exceed TotalButter units
Flour used for almond croissants and pistachio croissants cannot exceed TotalFlour units
At least AlmondPistachioRatio times as many almond croissants should be made as pistachio croissants
target_parameters: Units of butter required for an almond croissant
Units of flour required for an almond croissant
Units of butter required for a pistachio croissant
Units of flour required for a pistachio croissant
Proportion of almond croissants relative to pistachio croissants
Production time for an almond croissant
Production time for a pistachio croissant
